verses.verse: So I returned, <WH7725> and considered <WH7200> all <WH3605> the oppressions <WH6217> that are done <WH6213> under <WH8478> the sun: <WH8121> and behold <WH2009> the tears <WH1832> of such as were oppressed, <WH6231> and they had no <WH369> comforter; <WH5162> and on the side <WH3027> of their oppressors <WH6231> there was power; <WH3581> but they had no <WH369> comforter.
Why I praised <WH7623> the dead <WH4191> which are already <WH3528> dead <WH4191> more <WH4481> than <WH4480> the living <WH2416> which <WH834> are yet <WH5728> alive. <WH2416>

Yes, better <WH2896> is he than both <WH8147> they, which <WH834> has not yet <WH5728> been, <WH1961> who <WH834> has not seen <WH7200> the evil <WH7451> work <WH4639> that is done <WH6213> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

Again, I considered <WH7200> all <WH3605> travail, <WH5999> and every <WH3605> right <WH3788> work, <WH4639> that for this <WH1931> a man <WH376> is envied <WH7068> of his neighbor. <WH7453> This <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>
The fool <WH3684> folds <WH2263> his hands <WH3027> together, and eats <WH398> his own flesh. <WH1320>
Better <WH2896> is an handful <WH4393> <WH3709> with quietness, <WH5183> than both the hands <WH2651> full <WH4393> with travail <WH5999> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>
Then I returned, <WH7725> and I saw <WH7200> vanity <WH1892> under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

There is one <WH259> alone, and there is not a second; <WH8145> yes, <WH1571> he has neither <WH1571> <WH369> child <WH1121> nor brother: <WH251> yet is there no <WH369> end <WH7093> of all <WH3605> his labor; <WH5999> neither <WH3808> is his eye <WH5869> satisfied <WH7646> with riches; <WH6239> neither said he, For whom <WH4310> do I labor, <WH6001> and bereave <WH2637> my soul <WH5315> of good? <WH2896> This <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity, <WH1892> yes, it is a sore <WH7451> travail. <WH6045>
Two <WH8147> are better <WH2896> than one; <WH259> because <WH834> they have <WH3426> a good <WH2896> reward <WH7939> for their labor. <WH5999>

For if <WH518> they fall, <WH5307> the one <WH259> will lift <WH6965> up his fellow: <WH2270> but woe <WH337> to him that is alone <WH259> when he falls; <WH5307> for he has not another <WH8145> to help <WH6965> him up.
Again, <WH1571> if <WH518> two <WH8147> lie <WH7901> together, then they have heat: <WH2552> but how <WH349> can one <WH259> be warm <WH3179> alone?
And if <WH518> one <WH259> prevail <WH8630> against him, two <WH8147> shall withstand <WH5975> him; and a threefold <WH8027> cord <WH2339> is not quickly <WH4120> broken. <WH5423>

Better <WH2896> is a poor <WH4542> and a wise <WH2450> child <WH3206> than an old <WH2205> and foolish <WH3684> king, <WH4428> who <WH834> will <WH3045> no <WH3808> more <WH5750> be admonished. <WH2094>
For out of prison <WH1004> <WH612> he comes <WH3318> to reign; <WH4427> whereas <WH3588> also <WH1571> he that is born <WH3205> in his kingdom <WH4438> becomes poor. <WH7326>
I considered <WH7200> all <WH3605> the living <WH2416> which walk <WH1980> under <WH8478> the sun, <WH8121> with the second <WH8145> child <WH3206> that shall stand <WH5975> up in his stead. <WH8478>

There is no <WH369> end <WH7093> of all <WH3605> the people, <WH5971> even of all <WH3605> that have been <WH1961> before <WH6440> them: they also <WH1571> that come <WH314> after <WH314> shall not rejoice <WH8055> in him. Surely <WH3588> this <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7475> of spirit. <WH7307>
